data.title: Today's latest from Al Jazeera
data.meta_description: Stay on top of South Korea latest developments on the ground with Al Jazeera’s fact-based news, exclusive video footage, photos and updated maps.
data.text:
China has filed for more patents than any other country, but US export controls are not its only hurdle.

North Korea has been expanding its short-range weaponry designed to overwhelm missile defences in South Korea.

IOC chief Bach speaks with President Yoon Suk-yeol after South Korea seeks assurances that mistake is not repeated.

We delve into the declining marriage rates, focusing on Asia, and analyse the contributing factors to this trend.

South Korean Presidential Security Service says balloon did not contain any dangerous materials.

Peacekeepers at the Demilitarized Zone dividing the Koreas say their job is getting more complex amid evolving threats.

Activists welcome ruling but systemic discrimination persists in country where gay marriage is not legally recognised.

Indictment says Sue Mi Terry received luxury handbags and dinners at Michelin-starred restaurants in exchange.

South Korea’s fight against rampant sexism and gender-based violence faces a growing backlash to feminism.

South Korea says it plans to expand the laser programme to hit larger targets including aircraft and ballistic missiles.

Weather agency says the severity of the precipitation is only seen ‘once in about 200 years’.

Lee Jae-myung suffered a wound to his jugular vein and underwent emergency surgery after the attack in January.

South Korean military says Pyongyang’s claim of successful launch ‘likely to be false’.
